title: [GAMEPLAY] Sona's ambient music no longer plays.
body:
Ever since Sona's been reworked, only her Q music plays after a spell cast, including when the game begins. It's really a shame since each song really fit the spell. Only hearing the Q music really feels weird for her identity since it's all about music and its many abilities (in the Valoranian/LoL universe). 

Here's what her music is for Q, which is the only song you hear in-game: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4qPfCKv0csU&amp;t=1m57s
 Here's what her music should sound like for her W. It's characterized by the higher pitched "healing" sound resonating throughout: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4qPfCKv0csU&amp;t=3m21s
 Here's what her music should sound like for her E. It's definitely a lot faster and has a more frantic vibe:  
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4qPfCKv0csU&amp;t=4m57s

Here's a video of me using all her spells along with the music afterwards: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mkBwLWCkqiI 
The music's a little quiet but if you listen closely you can hear that they all sound the same as the first segment of the video parts I showed.

I know it's not *the* most important thing but it does play a key part in how Sona feels to play for me.

Steps to recreate:
1. Begin any game mode and pick Sona in champion select.
2. When in-game, reach level three, adding one point into a different ability each level.
3. Cast Hymn of Valor, or the ability on the Q key for Sona.
4. Listen to the style of the melody that plays afterwards for about one minute.
5. Repeat steps three and four for Aria of Perseverance, Sona's W ability, and Song of Celerity, Sona's E ability.
